quote: Slowly our ghosts drag home
Love of God seems dying
Merciless iced east winds that knive us...
king of kings: Look on my works, ye Mighty and despair!
I met a traveller from an antique land
Wrinkled lip and sneer of cold command
A shattered visage lies
How the youthful harlot’s curse / Blasts the newborn infant’s tear
Mind forged manacles I hear:
The hapless soldier’s sigh/Runs in blood down palace walls
Strode after me. With trembling oars i turned
No familiar shapes/ Remained, no pleasant images of trees
It was an act of stealth; and troubled pleasure
I gave commands; / Then all smiles stopped together.
part: My Last Duchess by Robert Browning

quote: Sudden successive flights of bullets streak the silence
Charging an army, while / All the world wonder'd
part: The Charge of the Light Brigade by Alfred Lord Tennyson

quote: Theirs not to make reply, / Theirs not to reason why, / Theirs but to do and die
part: The Charge of the Light Brigade by Alfred Lord Tennyson

quote: Into the jaws of Death, / Into the mouth of Hell
part: The Charge of the Light Brigade by Alfred Lord Tennyson

quote: Probably armed, possibly not
I see every round as it rips through his life - I see broad daylight on the other side
His bloody life in my bloody hands
Leaned against it like a wishbone
Sellotape bandaged around my hand
I was brave, as I walked with you, to the front door, threw it open
Gelled blackthorns of your hair
As though this were a church and he a priest preparing to intone a Mass
part: War Photographer by Carol Ann Duffy

quote: Solutions slop in trays beneath his hands, which did not tremble then though seem to now
part: War Photographer by Carol Ann Duffy

quote: Spools of suffering set out in ordered rows
part: War Photographer by Carol Ann Duffy

quote: All flesh is grass
part: War Photographer by Carol Ann Duffy

quote: Enough fuel for a one-way journey into history
And sometimes, she said, he must have wondered which had been the better way to die.
And though he came back my mother never spoke again in his presence
